result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury
Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan Ronald Brenna

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

$2,500 BOND ON FILE

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Katy K, her 2 children or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant can return to residence with law enforcement one time only to retrieve personal belongings.
   
If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:53 AM CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video w/ Dylan Ronald Brenna who appeared in person.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim via zoom. V/W present. Atty Davis notes DE waives time limits for PH. Case in on fast track, noting dates for SETC and PSC. Victim via zoom wishes to address bond. Victim asks in N/C order can be addressed. Court notes victims request to modify bond filed 7/26; which was denied 7/27. Atty Becker responds. Court would set a bond hearing if has information showing victim would be safe. Victim notes assessments that have been done and are being done as well as safety plan in place. DE confirms address on record.  Court will not modify bond today. Adjourned:  11:06 am.
Filed by DE. kma

10:45 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Dylan Ronald Brenna in court. Court reviews case. DE states that his employment has changed and believes he may qualify for court-appointed attorney now. 10:48 AM - RECESS. 11:26 AM - Case recalled. DE files amended PFAC to reflect current employment and income status. Court approves court appointed attorney, repayment rate of $50 per month. Court finds good cause to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Victim requests bond modification. State objects to bond modification at this time. Court denies bond modification. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Adjourned: 11:31 AM. kma

1:20 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson with intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dylan Ronald Brenna appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Dylan Ronald Brenna. DE does not qualify for PD.  Court addresses DE regarding Atty, sets STC for next week to check status of Atty.  DE given PFAC.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond argument.  Court sets bond, PH will be scheduled next week at STC. Adjourned at 1:32 PM
